dcsl_swarm_director_node.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 
00003 ## @file
00004 #  A node that subscribes to the cmd_vel_array topic with TwistArray messages and publishes cmd_velX topics with Twist messages where X is the array index from the TwistArray. 
00005 
00006 ## @author Brendan Andrade
00007 
00008 
00009 
00010 import roslib
00011 roslib.load_manifest('dcsl_swarm_director')
00012 import rospy
00013 from geometry_msgs.msg import Twist
00014 from dcsl_messages.msg import TwistArray
00015 
00016 ## Splits a TwistArray message on one topic into Twist messages on multiple topics
00017 class SwarmDirector:
00018     
00019     ## Sets up publishers and subscribers
00020     #
00021     # @param nRobots is the number of entries in the TwistArray
00022     def __init__(self,nRobots):
00023         self.n = nRobots
00024         self.publisherArray = []
00025         for i in range(0,self.n):
00026             name = "cmd_vel"+str(i)
00027             publisher = rospy.Publisher(name,Twist)
00028             self.publisherArray.append(publisher)
00029         self.cmdArray_sub = rospy.Subscriber("cmd_vel_array",TwistArray, self.callback)
00030         
00031     ## Callback function for the TwistArray 
00032     #
00033     # Routes each Twist in the TwistArray to the appropriate topic
00034     def callback(self,data):
00035         for i in range(0,self.n):
00036             command = data.twists[i]
00037             self.publisherArray[i].publish(command)
00038 
00039 ## Main function which is called when the node begins
00040 # 
00041 # Receives the "/n_robots" parameter. Initializes the node and creates the SwarmDirector object.
00042 def main():
00043     nRobots = rospy.get_param("/n_robots",1)
00044     rospy.init_node('dcsl_swarm_director')
00045     director = SwarmDirector(nRobots)
00046 
00047     try: 
00048         rospy.spin()
00049     except KeyboardInterrupt:
00050         print "Shutting down"
00051 
00052 if __name__ == '__main__':
00053     main()
